intro: Senecio gwinnerianus, commonly known as the Gwinner's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in rock gardens or as an ornamental plant.
